properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Hamlet Of Livelong In The R.m. Of Mervin No. 499
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory that was issued for the Hamlet of Livelong. This advisory is for the entire hamlet and for any individuals who may access water from the Livelong water system. This advisory has been extended until May 12, 2020.
Expires: 2020-05-12T15:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin, 2020-05-05T15:51:25-06:00, B81EC94C-E64C-E72D-6FB5-FF5D1815082C
Area: R.M. of Mervin No. 499
properties.Author: SK Turtleford and RM of Mervin

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall tonight. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Time span: continuing until early Wednesday morning. Locations: The Great Northern Peninsula. Remarks: The most significant accumulations will likely occur inland and over higher terrain where temperatures will generally be cooler than along the coast. Along the coast, snow will be wet or possibly mixed with rain throughout the event. The snow will change to rain over all areas Wednesday morning before tapering to flurries or rain showers by noon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-06T10:25:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-05T18:26:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0999076890.2020
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A spring snowfall is expected. Locations: Upper Lake Melville and the coast from Rigolet north to Hopedale. Total snowfall: 10 - 20 cm. Time span: Overnight through Wednesday. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries or showers Wednesday night or on Thursday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-06T05:45:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-05T13:46:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0416370284.2020
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity, Upper Lake Melville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Resort Village Of Manitou Beach
properties.Summary:
Description: Effective immediately a precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert is being issued by the Resort Village of Manitou Beach. The advisory is for the entire Resort Village of Manitou Beach and any individuals who may access water from the Resort Village of Manitou beach system. This includes the Watrous South Rural Water Utility. This advisory is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-05-11T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-05T09:51:55-06:00, 83427B56-3BA3-7809-E446-6A44F747CCFF
Area: Resort Village of Manitou Beach
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow, at times heavy, is expected. Locations: Upper Lake Melville and Churchill Valley. Total snowfall: 15 to 25 cm. Time span: overnight tonight to overnight Wednesday night. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-05-06T20:35:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T04:36:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1390375029.2020
Area: Upper Lake Melville, Churchill Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop to near or below the freezing mark overnight tonight. The relatively cool weather for this time of the year will last several more days. As a result, the frost advisory for Southwestern Quebec may be maintained for all nights and mornings through the rest of this week, possibly into Saturday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-06T12:09:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-05T20:10:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2540273498.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wet heavy snow tonight and Wednesday. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm or more over the Highlands. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h. Locations: northern Cape Breton Island. Higher elevations are most at risk for highest snowfall amounts. Time span: into Wednesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-06T17:45:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-06T01:46:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1863509859.2020
Area: Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
